intro: Clidemia, commonly known as false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants typically have opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves and produce showy, often pink or red, flowers. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Some species are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
